member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Xml.Section.TextExport
member.summary: The ActiveReports for .NET Text Export Component.

remarks.para: The default character encoding used for the TextExport is ASCII. If your reports may contain internationalized characters then consider using the property to specify the or instead. The current Encodingï¿½s preamble is written out according to the rules of .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Sets or returns the text inserted between pages.

member.summary: Sets or returns the text inserted between text fields.

member.summary: Gets or sets the quotation symbol.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Xml.Section.TextExport.QuotationMode
member.summary: If QuotationMode.AutoQuote than simple values will be exported without quotes. If QuotationMode.AlwaysQuote than all exported values will always be quoted.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Xml.Section.TextExport.SuppressEmptyLines
member.summary: Determines whether empty lines will be inserted for layout purposes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Xml.Section.TextExport.Pagination
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicates should pagination be used for resulted text document or not

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Export.Xml.Section.TextExport.Export(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Document.SectionDocument,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Exports the specified document to a text format file.
member.param: The ActiveReports Document object to export.
The file name and path to save the main html file to.
A range of page numbers to export seperated by a comma. Between each comma can have a single page number, or range of pages with a hyphen between the starting and ending page numbers in the range.

member.summary: Exports the specified document to the specified stream in text format.

The Stream to write the text to.

yes

member.summary: Specifies the setting name that determines the text encoding to use.
member.remarks: Valid values are the code page name of the preferred encoding. For example: utf-8, utf-16, utf-32, iso-8859-1, iso-2022-jp, etc... Default: utf-8
